meanings.definition: Make uniform or similar in composition or nature.
meanings.sent1: She is homogenising the colors to make them all the same shade.
meanings.sent2: The chef is homogenising the ingredients to create a smooth batter.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally homogenised the paint colors, creating a new shade.
meanings.sent4: The music producer is homogenising different sounds to create a unique track.
meanings.sent5: By homogenising the data, the scientist was able to identify patterns more easily.

meanings.sent1: He is homogenising the spices to create a flavorful blend.
meanings.sent2: The blender is homogenising the fruits to make a smoothie.
meanings.sent3: The kids had fun homogenising different playdough colors together.
meanings.sent4: The DJ is homogenising various beats to create a seamless mix.
meanings.sent5: Homogenising the ingredients ensures a consistent taste in the dish.
